image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Kentucky; born in Lexington, Ky., July 9, 1941; B.S., University of Kentucky, Lexington, Ky., 1963; J.D., University of Kentucky, Lexington, Ky., 1966; United States Army reserve, 1966-1972; admitted to the bar in 1966 and commenced the practice of law; administrator, Fayette County, Ky. legal aid, 1967-1973; vice mayor of Fayette County, Ky., 1974-1977; Fayette County, Ky. district judge, 1979-1981; unsuccessful candidate in 1991 for nomination for Governor of Kentucky; Mayor of Lexington, Ky., 1982-1993; chairman, Kentucky economic planning commission, 1987; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 1999); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Sixth Congress but was an unsuccessful candidate in 1998 for election to the United States Senate.

researchRecord.name: n.d., approximately 42 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: The collection includes congressional materials, photographs, and audio-visual film and video tapes documenting Scotty Baesler's career. Access to the collection is restricted during Scotty Baesler's lifetime.

recordLocation.name: Special Collections and Archives, Wendell A. Ford Research Center and Public Policy Archives
